intro: Becium, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to southern Africa and includes several species, such as Becium africanum and Becium sinuatum. These plants are characterized by their milky sap, which is toxic and can cause skin irritation. The leaves are typically alternate and often have a rough or hairy texture. Becium species are often found in rocky or sandy soils and can thrive in arid environments.
